alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 5:55PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Boise and central Elmore Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 555 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Arrowrock Reservoir, or 20 miles south of Idaho City, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Arrowrock Reservoir around 600 PM MDT. Twin Springs around 610 PM MDT. Thorn Creek Summit around 630 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
